comments.author: eric
comments.message: As an end user of the web these standards seem like a no-brainer to me. KISS- keep it simple stupid. (posted from my blackberry mobile device which could actually read and comment on this article with ease! Thank you!)

comments.author: Michael Kozakewich
comments.message:
You've got a 960-pixel minimum.

I've had an epiphany: It's actually a good thing that IE6 is sticking around. In the long run, it's teaching us a valuable lesson. The web should be open for anyone, anytime. Even ten years in the future, people should be able to view a site's content on IE6.
We're all far too lazy. We've got to learn to make everything progressively enhanced.

comments.author: Zach Leatherman
comments.message:
True, it looks like the blog template I use on this site uses a min-width of 940px, and it'd be better as a fluid layout. There's always room for improvement!

Glad you got something out of the article!
